com.xebialabs.overthere

Class CmdLineArgument

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xebialabs.overthere.CmdLineArgument
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public abstract class CmdLineArgument
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents a single command line argument.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • arg

        public static CmdLineArgument arg(java.lang.String arg)
        Creates a regular argument.
        Parameters:
        arg - the argument string.
        Returns:
        the created argument.

      • password

        public static CmdLineArgument password(java.lang.String arg)
        Creates a password argument. When encoded for execution, a password argument is encoded like a regular argument. When encoded for logging, a password argument is always encoded as eight stars (********).
        Parameters:
        arg - the argument string.
        Returns:
        the created argument.

      • raw

        public static CmdLineArgument raw(java.lang.String arg)
        Creates a raw argument. When encoded for execution or for logging, a raw argument is left as-is.

      • nested

        public static CmdLineArgument nested(CmdLine line)
        Creates a nested command line argument. When encoded for execution or for logging, a nested command will be quoted. Useful for instance when executing su -c ''
        Parameters:
        line - the nested command line
        Returns:
        the created command

      • toString

        public final java.lang.String toString(OperatingSystemFamily os,
                        boolean forLogging)
        Returns a string representation of this argument.
        Parameters:
        os - the operating system to encode for.
        forLogging - true if this string representation will be used for logging.
        Returns:
        the string representation of this argument.

      • buildString

        public abstract void buildString(OperatingSystemFamily os,
               boolean forLogging,
               java.lang.StringBuilder builder)
        Builds a string representation of this argument.
        Parameters:
        os - the operating system to encode for.
        forLogging - true if this string representation will be used for logging.
        builder - the StringBuilder to append to.
